channel.title: Corrupted Section In My Harddrive?
channel.description:
Hey,
I recently re-installed windows from a crack found in the tutorials section. But, the format directions didn't work, so I figured what ever, I can just delete the files manually when the new Windows is installed. So, I went to C:\Documents and Settings\, and then clicked on the user from the old version, and tried to delete it. But, when I tried it wouldn't let me. So I figured oh, that's cool, it's probably just read only. So, I unchecked that in the properties, and went back, deleted it, but it said it couldn't. When that happens I usually just delete all the files I can, and then I would find the file that I was unable to delete, and then write a kill script or something for it. Anyways, now when I even CLICK on the folder, access is denied. Some of you might be saying, oh who cares, it's just a folder. Well, some of the people who are saying that don't have 18.5GB hard drives.. And now I only have 3.52GB because all of the files are still in that user folder. Anyone have any solutions for my problem?
Thanks,
Buzzy

item.title: Corrupted Section In My Harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:2, topic:33437”][quote author=Buzzy link=topic=48198.msg591643#msg591643 date=1165673135]
Hey,

 I recently re-installed windows from a crack found in the tutorials section. But, the format directions didn't work, so I figured what ever, I can just delete the files manually when the new Windows is installed. So, I went to C:\Documents and Settings\, and then clicked on the user from the old version, and tried to delete it. But, when I tried it wouldn't let me. So I figured oh, that's cool, it's probably just read only. So, I unchecked that in the properties, and went back, deleted it, but it said it couldn't. When that happens I usually just delete all the files I can, and then I would find the file that I was unable to delete, and then write a kill script or something for it. Anyways, now when I even CLICK on the folder, access is denied. Some of you might be saying, oh who cares, it's just a folder. Well, some of the people who are saying that don't have 18.5GB hard drives.. And now I only have 3.52GB because all of the files are still in that user folder. Anyone have any solutions for my problem?

Thanks,

Buzzy
[/quote]

I think I’ve had this problem before. Maybe you should try making a new user that has the same name as the old user.[/quote]

Like Leader said, you would have to make a new user, but then, well…do this

                       [center][b]-DEFAULT-[/b][/center]

  1. Make a new COMPUTER ADMINISTRATOR, NOT LIMITED.

  2. Restart computer and when rebooted, log on the new account.

  3. Try deleting the folder from that account.

  4. If that doesn’t help, maybe try logging in safe mode and deleting it from there.

[center]-SECONDARY, BUT FORCEFUL-[/center]

  1. Boot computer, press the F*(F1, F2) button corresponding to that which activates system restore.

  2. Go through destructive system restore(you may want to save your files before doing so).

  3. Try installing windows again.

OK, that was just a makeshift tut…But I think it may work(the default). If it doesn’t work, post back here and I will try to help…And if it does work, glad I could help

P.s. Why are you re-installing windows? you mean upgrading?

Read full topic

Buzzy[/quote]

I think I’ve had this problem before. Maybe you should try making a new user that has the same name as the old user.

Read full topic
